ROC A12
educations.description: Intermediate Vocational Education in Software Development

projects.name: OVpay
description: OVpay is one of several projects I have been involved with while working for Info Support.

In this project, I was involved with the development of the MAUI app, Angular/React.JS front-ends and back-end .NET Core APIs. I developed the multiple cards component (visible at the top of the page), for example. This has made it possible to add more than one card to your OVpay account (with a current limit of 10).
In addition I also participated in the OPS shifts in case of failures.

projects.name: Klokhuis Game Studio
description: For a Dutch TV program I have been working on the 'Game Studio' for the past few months.

The Game Studio is a web app that makes it possible for children to build their own games and then share them with each other. It is possible to build very simple to very advanced games with the Game Studio.
I mainly worked on the project structure of the Gamekit and the React components that allow the user to set up game objects.
At this the Game Studio is playable with the link above!

projects.name: RGS Analyzer/Mapper
description: This assignment has been developed at Minox. I have created a system that makes it possible to link existing general ledger accounts to RGS (reference general ledger scheme). RGS is a list of codes and levels created by the government to make it easier for accounting systems to connect to each other.
For this assignment I made the following parts: RGS Robot, RGS Mapper and the RGS Analyzer.

These RGS codes are cleverly linked to general ledger accounts with the RGS Robot. This robot can also give suggestions based on previously made mappings of codes. Thanks to these mappings, an accountant can quickly get a good overview of an administration, and these rules can also be shared between other administrations.
Thanks to this assignment, Minox was the first company to receive the RGS Ready certificate. RGS Ready proves that a software package fully supports RGS.

projects.name: HomeReval
projects.for: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht

media.name: Record screen in Unity with XBOX kinect

description: This project was developed for ProjectB: “ProjectB is the competition between student teams in the last or penultimate year of their IT studies. Students are challenged to use information technology to support the lives of people with disabilities or even to improve their quality of life.” Sogeti. (2019, 5 June).

HomeReval is a product in which it is possible to record exercises in collaboration with a physiotherapist and then perform them at home. This gives the physiotherapist immediate insight into how often the exercises are done and how well a patient performs the exercises by means of a score and recordings.

During this project I was mainly involved with the Unity application and developed the algorithm that records exercises and then compares them with repetitions of that exercise. The initial exercise is stored on the server and can therefore be practiced anywhere.
Insight for the physical therapist was possible via a React web app that could display the recordings and indicated how often a patient had done the exercise.
